channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NY

item.title: Report X-2023061566
item.description:
Report X-2023061566

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-22T00:38:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-22
  • City: FARMINGTON
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The hazmat was on the rollers in unload and was pushed along with the ICs. It was accidentally pushed to the floor. DescribePack: The package had one gallon rupture at the cap when it hit the floor. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The belts in the building were stopped, and the hazmat was placed in a red tote by QA. No package handlers touched the damage hazmat, and there was no leakage from the hazmat to other packages.

item.title: Report X-2023061550
item.description:
Report X-2023061550

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-20T21:09:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-21
  • City: BINGHAMTON
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Q.A. found a leaking hazmat in the unload area placed on the rollers. After finding the damaged package it was placed in a tote and transported to the hazmat cage to be evaluated and repacked into a salvage drum. DescribePack: the corrosive liquid ate through the box causing a 3x6 hole in the right-hand side of the box. two of the four bottles had loose caps causing leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: the hazmat was taken from the unload and placed in a tote to contain any more toxins and liquid from escaping into a un-contained area until it was taken to the hazmat cage to be safely repacking into a salvage drum.

Report X-2023061253

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Qa was called to the trailer to check on package upon further inspection qa saw that the contents inside were leaking due to the loose cap and mishandling of the package DescribePack: one of the caps were loose and ill fitting DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was removed from the trailer instantly and processed

item.title: Report X-2023061251
item.description:
Report X-2023061251

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-19T21:09:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-19
  • City: RENSSELAER
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: No one witnessed the cause of the incident, they only realized it was leaking as it came down the belt. Based on the appearance of the jerrican, the dents and dirt covering the bottom, I surmise that the crack formed from the wear and tear packages typically receive in transit. DescribePack: The crack is in the bottom corner of the jug, barely an inch long but the location made the contents leak quickly. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Item was immediately placed in a hazmat drum, spillage was covered with absorbent pads to clean up.

item.title: Report E-2023060764
item.description:
Report E-2023060764

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-18T15:09:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-13
  • City: ROCHESTER
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 13, 2023, at 0548 ET, XPO Logistics Terminal XRC, experienced a Lithium Hydroxide release from a 50-pound paper bag due to improper loading. ERTS dispatched Hepaco to conduct all on site cleanup and overpacking operations. On June 13, 2023, at 0858 EST, Hepaco personnel arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-pounds of product released to a 5' x 5' area of the trailer floor due to improper loading. The damaged bag and released product were collected and containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. All remaining bags were re-secured for shipment on. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023061188

Report X-2023061188

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: metal drum was found at door 218 dented and leaking. manager called out to QA for a leaking hazmat and was contained and taken to QA for inspection. DescribePack: metal drum was dented on the neck of the drum causing a crack to form leaking. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA contained it, putting it inside a yellow salvage drum and filled out the reports.

item.title: Report X-2023061131
item.description:
Report X-2023061131

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-17T15:10:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-10
  • City: FARMINGTON
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Handlers were unloading trailer, and the package was an unmarked hazmat. As a package handler was reaching for another package that fell and hit the unmarked hazmat knocking it to the floor. This caused the top of the pail to come loose, and the contents leaked out of the package. This occurred around 5am. DescribePack: The top of the package came loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA was called for clean up, and the belts were stopped for the station. Gloves, litter, and n95 masks were used during clean up. Handlers were removed from trailer, and n95s were given to handlers nearby. The doors were opened, and the fans were turned on.

item.title: Report X-2023061123
item.description:
Report X-2023061123

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-17T15:10:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-13
  • City: BUFFALO
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: On 06/13/2023, during preload sort, a package containing four bottles of Spor-Klenz Concentrate was discovered to be damaged and leaking contents. After discovery, package staged in hazmat cage on site for future processing DescribePack: Four bottles leaking contents from loose caps and punctured seals DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: After damaged package was discovered, it was placed in red Fedex Hazmat bin with plastic liner and staged in hazmat cage for future processing. Any liquid that leaked out of package cleaned with absorbent and proper PPE
